requirement_designation: Humanities and Arts with Race & Ethnicity(*)
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 261 1)
What does it mean to create literature in society that doesn't view you as fully human? This course will answer this question by examining black literary and cultural history. Spanning the eighteenth to turn-of-the-century, we will read early fiction and nonfiction to illuminate how the black writing tradition shaped American culture.
course_description: An overview of African-American literature prior to 1900. Students will read and examine writings by major contributors to each period in the genres of fiction (short story and novel) essay, poetry, and narratives of enslavement. Students will write four five-page critical essays.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E363
